review_title: Definitely think twice before working here

pros:
The staff members are, for the most part, absolutely wonderful to work with

It was great to help provide the underserved with access to services
cons:
Upper management is no longer focused on patient care, just lining their own pockets

Low pay

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Coeur d'Alene, ID
pros: Flexible schedule, no micromanaging of time, paid holidays, benefits, work life balance
cons: Employee retention. With over 200 employees, a handful have been around longer than 2 years and even far less after 5. Financial incentives are not given based on performance (at least in my experience) Lack of communication between departments. Poor employee moral and environment.  I also complained to management several times about an employee and never got any sort of response. Some of the admin team or higher ups, did not have the training, education or experience to be in the jobs they were at.  While I'm very passionate about the organization, I would not recommend working here to a friend.

review_title: The Best People in the World Work Here!
job_title: Chief Executive Officer in Coeur d'Alene, ID
pros: Heritage Health is an incredible organization. Our teams are filled with the best people on the planet. Our tagline is healthcare from the heart and everyone tries their best to live that way. You will find innovation, collaboration  and a healthy challenge at Heritage Health. Our people seek us out and they choose to work here because they know that they can make a difference.
cons: Healthcare is a challenging field right now. Like any organization, we are working  to improve communications and our internal systems. The workload can be a challenge for people that don't have a strong work ethic.

job_title: Executive Assistant in Coeur d'Alene, ID
pros: One of the biggest pros is the amazing people I have the honor of working with.  They really take Heritage's mission to heart.  The employees are actually appreciated AND recognized!  It is the most positive, upbeat environment I've ever worked in.
cons: When you first start, there are a lot of acronyms tossed around.  It's very hard to learn what they all mean.  Fortunately, questions are ok!

job_title: CNA in Coeur d'Alene, ID
pros: Work schedule is 8 to 6:30pm 4 days a week.
cons: No training for new employees. This place only allows you 2 minutes with the patients. Then your on to the next. Everyone(employees) is new. No ones been there a lengthy amount of time. Patients deserve more time. Crappy place to work.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Coeur d'Alene, ID
pros: I love the mission of Heritage Health.  We have amazing staff that truly deliver healthcare from the heart.   We have the best team that come up with innovative programs to help our patients improve their health.  Throughout the organization, we practice teamwork.  Our ideas and suggestions are welcomed by our leadership.
cons: Workload  may seem overwhelming at times, but those with a strong work ethic thrive.

job_title: Director of Cultural in Coeur d'Alene, ID
pros: I love the people I work with here at Heritage Health. It is amazing how much they care about our patients and our community. We finished 2017 with almost 30,000 patients. Our team has a heart to serve. We are always looking at ways to expand access for our patients.
cons: There is more of a need than we can take on.

job_title: Medical Assistant Certified in Post Falls, ID
pros: Great community of people to serve, relationship with provider and nursing staff is awesome.
cons: Professionalism and management to be desired. Office politics are a little out of hand. Lack of teamwork.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Coeur d'Alene, ID
pros: Our providers and support staff care about our patients, they care about good outcomes and they are dedicated to our mission which is to provide quality, affordable care to all in our community .
